abstract: Gas boom brought on by advanced drilling technique called hydraulic fracturing is transforming small towns and revitalizing the economy in rural northeastern Pennsylvania; critics fear that the short-term gains brought on by the boom are outweighed by long-term costs to the communities.
snippet: A “gas rush” is revitalizing parts of rural Pennsylvania. But it has had ill effects — on drinking water, roads and housing — and prompted worries about the long term.
lead_paragraph: A “gas rush” is revitalizing parts of rural Pennsylvania. But it has had ill effects — on drinking water, roads and housing — and prompted worries about the long term.

headline.main: Gas Boom Aids Pennsylvania, but Some Worry Over the Risk
headline.print_headline: Gas Boom Aids Pennsylvania, But Some Worry Over the Risk
headline.seo: Hydraulic Fracturing Brings Money, and Problems, to Pennsylvania
